metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: Greta, known affectionately as 'Greatness' by the brokers, is a woman in her 40s who serves as the office manager of Bel Inc. — though she functions more as an office mother. She possesses a wholesome beauty, a perma-smile, and a sing-song voice. Her desk area is decorated in yellow and feels like a country home. She is the emotional and logistical backbone of the office, nurturing new employees, managing chaos with grace, and maintaining warm relationships with even the most unruly brokers.
data.dialogue_summary: Greta's dialogue is warm, instructional, and maternal. She guides Dante through the office with a sing-song narration of company culture, rules, and personalities. She introduces Dante to the brokers with playful affection, defuses tension with humor, and offers genuine emotional support. Her speech is peppered with diminutives ('Oopsies!', 'shall we?', 'love') and gentle authority. She also serves as a conduit for Abe's instructions, relaying reservation requests and office logistics without complaint. Her most revealing line — 'You will' (in response to Dante saying she doesn't smoke) — hints at a knowing, slightly fatalistic wisdom about the office's effect on people.

explicit_evidence.quote: You come and see me if you need anything. Ok? I mean that. Anything at all, I am here for you.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. BEL INC. OFFICE - 11:30AM / INT. BEL INC. - GRETA'S DESK - MORNING

explicit_evidence.quote: Greta, seemingly psychic, has already poured her a giant GLASS of water and hands her a TYLENOL. She picks up a box of BAND-AIDS and removes two.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. BEL INC. - GRETA'S DESK - MORNING

explicit_evidence.quote: Self-care is key. Always take care of yourself first.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. BEL INC. - GRETA'S DESK - MORNING

explicit_evidence.quote: She is aware of everyone around her and what they are doing -- even if she doesn't acknowledge it.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. BEL INC. CORRIDOR - RIGHT OF THE PIT (CONTINUOUS)

explicit_evidence.quote: Of course, Cassandra. We can finish our tour later.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. CORRIDOR IN FRONT OF I.T. DESKS - MORNING

explicit_evidence.quote: A few of the guys yell out 'GREATNESSSSSS!'. She is smiling at them and saying her good mornings.
Greta is just laughing as though they are her children doing a fun skit they made for mom.
explicit_evidence.trait: Tolerant and amused by bad behavior

explicit_evidence.quote: We see Greta rushing back like a Geisha to her top client. She has a fresh pair of SLACKS in one hand and a GLASS OF WATER in another. She is back in an abnormally fast time.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. 2ND LEVEL TRADING PIT - DANTE'S DESK

explicit_evidence.quote: Greta is proud of her position, and it shows.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. BEL INC. CORRIDOR - RIGHT OF THE PIT (CONTINUOUS)

explicit_evidence.quote: For the first time, Dante sees a slightly unimpressed look on Greta's face as she ignores Laynah's comment.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. 2ND LEVEL TRADING PIT - DANTE'S DESK

inferred_traits.rationale: Greta consistently smooths over awkward or hostile interactions — between Laynah and Dante, between the brokers and newcomers — without confrontation, acting as a social lubricant for the office.
Greta enforces company policy (shoe buffing Thursdays, elevator rules, smoking breaks) with cheerful authority, suggesting deep alignment with the institution's culture and hierarchy.
She anticipates Dante's physical needs (water, Tylenol, band-aids) before being asked, reads the room during the broker introduction, and knows when to step back (e.g., letting Cassandra take Dante).
She handles Yuri grabbing at her breasts, the brokers' crude behavior, and Laynah's passive aggression all without losing her composure or smile.

Though deferential to Abe and Cassandra, Greta commands the room when she claps her hands and addresses the brokers, who immediately comply. Her nickname 'Greatness' signals genuine respect from the floor.

data.name: GRETA

relationships.evidence: Greta personally tours Dante, anticipates her needs, physically supports her, introduces her to the floor, and offers unconditional availability: 'Anything at all, I am here for you.'
Greta relays Abe's calls, executes his reservation requests via Laynah, and enforces his company policies without question.
Greta immediately yields Dante to Cassandra without hesitation: 'Of course, Cassandra. We can finish our tour later.'
Greta ignores Laynah's passive-aggressive comment about Yuri, showing the only moment of visible displeasure in her otherwise cheerful demeanor.
Brokers shout 'GREATNESSSSSS!' at her arrival and comply when she calls for order, while she laughs at their antics with maternal indulgence.
Greta rushes to Yuri with slacks and water, administers a pill, and physically helps him up despite him grabbing at her — all without complaint.
